channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Creativity is as important as data literacy in the AI era, says IBM exec
item.description: Human ingenuity and a willingness to experiment are now vital for advancing in the AI economy.

item.title: Trump signs bill that will release all Epstein files
item.description: President Trump signed the bill Wednesday evening that forces the Justice Department to release all the files it has from its investigation into decea...

item.title: House refers censure resolution of Rep. Cory Mills to Ethics Committee
item.description: The House voted Wednesday night to refer a resolution to censure Rep. Cory Mills, Florida Republican, for a variety of alleged transgressions to the H...

item.title: Grade Inflation Is Deflating the Workforce
item.description: If colleges keep handing out meaningless grades, more testing could provide a better measure of what students have learned.

item.title: New U.N. Treaty Decriminalizes AI Child Sexual Abuse Images
item.description: Children should not have to bear the burden of protecting themselves from exploitation on online technology platforms.

item.title: Former aide to House rep accused of faking political attack
item.description: Natalie Greene, former aide to Rep. Jeff Van Drew, faces federal charges for allegedly faking a political attack in Egg Harbor Township over the summe...

item.title: Trump Gets Cozy with the Saudis
item.description: The U.S.-Saudi relationship is in a better place, even if it would behoove Trump to curb his enthusiasm.

item.title: Senior judge blasts court for 'pernicious ... misbehavior' in striking down Texas congressional map
item.description: Senior Circuit Judge Jerry Smith delivered a scorching takedown of a fellow federal judge on Wednesday, accusing his colleague of "unrestrained ideolo...

item.title: The Federalist Wins Dao Grand Prize For Russia Collusion Hoax Coverage
item.description: Reporting on the Russia Collusion hoax is part of The Federalist's years-long national security investigation.

item.title: Homeland Security’s Bloated ‘Intelligence’ Office Is Costing Taxpayers $348 Million Every Year
item.description: The Office of Intelligence and Analysis functions more as a cost center, complicating DHS's role in intelligence rather than enhancing it.

item.title: Federal judge allows Texas AG to challenge Harris County bail reforms: ‘Unleashing criminals’
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton wins court approval to intervene in a Harris County bail reform lawsuit, vowing to do "everything in my power" to re...

item.title: Now Is the Moment to Deregulate Obamacare
item.description: The window Republicans have won’t reappear anytime soon.

item.title: Tariff threats and Gen Z sobriety have put winemakers in Bordeaux on red alert
item.description: French wine production has plummeted to 60-year lows, as trade wars and changing drinking habits hurt sales.

item.title: Mamdani vows NYPD will 'never' go back to Adams-era cooperation with ICE enforcement
item.description: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani doubled down on a campaign pledge Wednesday, declaring the NYPD will be “delivering public safety, not assisting ICE."

item.title: Judge blocks Trump from ending deportation amnesty for Syrians
item.description: A federal judge ordered the Trump administration on Wednesday to postpone its plan to end a deportation amnesty for Syrian migrants, ruling the govern...

item.title: Christians Should Defend the Jewish People
item.description: In these times, those who claim the faith would be wise to point young men and women to the firm path of real Christianity.

item.title: Trump secures release of American trapped in Saudi Arabia for years over online posts
item.description: Saudi Arabia releases U.S. citizen Saad Almadi after four years for social media posts criticizing the royal family, following Trump's meeting with Cr...

item.title: Johor is building a 7300-acre innovation hub on the Singapore border, offering ‘land and scale’ for its neighbor’s ‘capital and speed’
item.description: Johor doesn't have the building blocks for innovation, Datuk Syed Mohamed Syed Ibrahim, JCorp's CEO, explained. “But in Singapore, there are.”

item.title: More Big Tech company debt ‘would increase the macro risks associated with the AI build-out,’ Goldman Sachs warns
item.description: Amazon, Google, Meta, Microsoft, and Oracle have taken on $121 billion in new debt, year-to-date—quadruple the amount from the prior five years.

item.title: Theater Kids In Congress Vaguely Urge Military To Disobey Commander-In-Chief
item.description: More mush from the wimps. Donald Trump is very bad, because mumble mumble mumble.

item.title: Trump says he will meet with NYC mayor-elect Mamdani Friday
item.description: President Trump said he will be meeting with New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani at the White House on Friday.

item.title: Blue states blasted for funneling millions in SNAP cash for fast food meals
item.description: Nine states allow SNAP benefits for fast food through Restaurant Meals Program, with California accounting for over 90% of the millions spent, Sen. Er...

item.title: Democrats’ Embrace Of Violent Rhetoric Will Mark Congressional Midterms
item.description: The violent rhetoric isn’t isolated, it’s becoming a feature of Democratic primaries as the party take a harder turn left.

item.title: We Sued an Ohio School District over Preferred Pronouns and Won
item.description: More should follow.

item.title: Stuut raises $29.5 million Series A led by Andreessen Horowitz to automate accounts receivable
item.description: Stuut has raised a $29.5 million Series A, led by Andreessen Horowitz, Fortune has exclusively learned.

item.title: Mind the Cycle: From Macro Shifts to Portfolio Plays
item.description: Markets move on change, not levels. Spot shifts in growth, inflation, and liquidity early to stay ahead of the global cycle. The post Mind the Cycle: ...

item.title: Private Markets: Why Retail Investors Should Stay Away
item.description: Retail access to private markets is growing, but opacity, illiquidity, and weak governance raise serious concerns for investors. The post Private Mark...

item.title: From Sharpe to Pedersen: Why Active Management Isn’t Zero-Sum After All
item.description: Sharpe’s arithmetic explained markets at rest. Pedersen’s model shows markets in motion and how active management creates real economic value. The pos...

item.title: Book Review: On Progress and Prosperity
item.description: A collection of witty insightful essays by Larry Siegel explore progress, investing, and the ideas shaping modern economics. The post Book Review: On ...
